articles.description: AN ASTEROID as big as a mountain will safely swing past Earth this week. Find out how you can watch the asteroid on the night of the flyby.

articles.title: World's first 3-D simulations of superluminous supernovae - Phys.org

articles.author: Sebastian Kettley
articles.title: Asteroid news: A 4KM rock will zip past Earth this week - astronomers can already see it - Express.co.uk
articles.description: AN ASTEROID big enough to be dubbed 'potentially hazardous' but considered safe by NASA, has been photographed dashing through the solar system.

articles.author: Sean Martin
articles.title: NASA releases out of this world image of flowing New York river - Express.co.uk
articles.description: NASA has released a quite literally out of this world image of the Susquehanna River in the US, snapped by astronauts onboard the International Space Station (ISS).
